meanings.definition: Geniuses (noun): exceptionally intelligent or talented individuals
meanings.sent1: The school celebrated the young geniuses who excelled in math and science.
meanings.sent2: Many geniuses throughout history have made groundbreaking discoveries.
meanings.sent3: The geniuses in the chess club always seemed to know the best moves ahead of time.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic skills were like those of a group of geniuses painting a masterpiece together.
meanings.sent5: The geniuses in the room shone brightly with their unique talents and ideas.

meanings.definition: Geniuses (verb): the plural form of the verb 'genius', meaning to exhibit exceptional intelligence or talent
meanings.sent1: The students geniuses their creativity during the art class.
meanings.sent2: She geniuses her problem-solving skills when faced with difficult tasks.
meanings.sent3: The team geniuses their way through the challenging puzzle, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: He geniuses his musical abilities, captivating the audience with his performance.
meanings.sent5: The young inventor geniuses a new gadget that amazed everyone with its innovation.
